"This enclosure was built between 1963 and 1964 in view of the need for a special place to protect part of the collections that were initially preserved in the Moneda Palace. "

" During the period of independent Mexico, Chapultepec served as a presidential residence where figures like Sebastián Lerdo de Tejada and Gral Porfirio Díaz lived, maintaining this function until the government of Lázaro Cárdenas who, in 1944, left this magnificent setting to settle in Los Pinos . From September 27 of that same year, El Castillo de Chapultepec would house the National History Museum."

The collection of this site was formed from collections of other museums to integrate a global vision of the evolution of Mexican art, from its beginnings in the colonial period, until the first part of the twentieth century.

" Franz Mayer was a German-born, naturalized Mexican antiquarian who, throughout his life, collected a large amount of artistic objects. Upon his death, the vast collection was donated to the people of Mexico and deposited for exhibition in this important museum."

" In the eight rooms that make up this enclosure, a great majority of the pieces found during the different periods of archaeological excavation from 1978 to the present day are exhibited. In them the evolution of the Mexica people is narrated, starting from its mythical pilgrimage from Aztlán in search of the promised land, until the foundation of the great Tenochtitlan."
